item.title: ReactJS-and-Redux
item.author: cyrusncy@gmail.com (CyrusN)
item.description: Function Components Stateless Functional Components in React 0.14 – Josh Black – Medium Since react 14.0, you can now use the new stateless function component instead of the instead of ES6 class method to define a component // stateless functional components function Welcome(props) { return <h1>Hello, {props.name}</h1>; } // using class to define a component class Welcome extends React.Component { render() { return <h1>Hello, {this.props.name}</h1>; } } or even cleaner

item.title: Create Startup Script in Linux
item.author: cyrusncy@gmail.com (CyrusN)
item.description: Create a new script in /etc/init.d/myscript. vi /etc/init.d/myscript (Obviously it doesn’t have to be called “myscript”.) In this script, do whatever you want to do. Perhaps just run the script you mentioned. #!/bin/sh /path/to/my/script.sh Make it executable. chmod 755 /etc/init.d/myscript Configure the init system to run this script at startup. update-rc.d myscript defaults

item.title: Update Digital Ocean Kernel
item.author: cyrusncy@gmail.com (CyrusN)
item.description: Check Which Kernel is Currently in Use To display both the kernel version and your system’s architecture (32-bit or 64-bit), type: uname -ir Upgrading All Packages and Using the Newest Kernel sudo apt-get update sudo apt-get dist-upgrade sudo reboot sudo apt-get install update-manager-core sudo do-release-upgrade Reference How To Upgrade to Ubuntu 16.04 LTS | DigitalOcean How To Update a DigitalOcean Server’s Kernel | DigitalOcean

item.title: Batch Download YouTube
item.author: cyrusncy@gmail.com (CyrusN)
item.description: Using youtube-dl to batch download YouTube to mp3 #!/bin/bash lists=( # list of YouTube ID ) youtube-dl --extract-audio --audio-format mp3 https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=${lists[@]}

item.title: Config Digtal Ocean Droplet as Microservice
item.author: cyrusncy@gmail.com (CyrusN)
item.description: Objective This page is a notes for setting apache server for my digital ocean droplet Setting Apache2 in file /etc/hosts change 127.0.0.1 localhost to 127.0.1.1 localhost WordPress-CaLP-LPSS change Port in file /etc/apache2/port.conf add ServerName localhost change the line listen *:80 to listen 127.0.0.1:4000 disable other modules <IfModule ssl_module> and <IfModule mod_gnutls.c> in file /etc/apache2/site-enabled/000-default.conf change the line <VirtualHost *:80> to <VirtualHost localhost:4000> restart apache2 run sudo /etc/init.

item.title: Open SSL
item.author: cyrusncy@gmail.com (CyrusN)
item.description: OpenSSL is a toolkit for the TLS and SSL. The Most Common OpenSSL Commands key/cert types X.509 - Wikiwand DER vs. CRT vs. CER vs. PEM Certificates and How To Convert Them .pem == .crt == X.509? probably .key == .csr == DER? probably not, .csr can be converted to .crt .pfx/.p12 == PKCS#12 key: no meta data, just the prime numbers and moduluses cert: with meta data cert generation How to create a .

item.title: SSL TLS
item.author: cyrusncy@gmail.com (CyrusN)
item.description: Transport Layer Security (TLS) and its predecessor, Secure Sockets Layer (SSL), are cryptographic protocols designed to provide communications security over a computer network. The authentication relied on Certificate Authorities (CA) and a public key infrastructure using X.509 certificates. The server register with a CA and sign its public key with the key of CA for a fee. The client, after receiving the public key from server, verifies it with the CA.

item.title: Settings of My OSX
item.author: cyrusncy@gmail.com (CyrusN)
item.description: Custom OSX Remove shift key augmentation for Mission Control animation Enable the three finger drag in Accessibility Terminal Autocomplete echo "set completion-ignore-case On" >> ~/.inputrc install command line tools in XCode xcode-select --install zsh install .oh-my-zsh symlink for setting zsh ## for installation of zsh ln -s Dropbox/MacSetting/Terminal/cyrusn ./.cyrusn ln -s ~/Dropbox/MacSetting/Terminal/zsh/.zshrc ~/ ln -s ~/Dropbox/MacSetting/Terminal/zsh/.zsh-custom ~/ ## for installation of coreutil/.dir_colors ln -s ~/Dropbox/MacSetting/Terminal/coreutil/.

item.title: useful command line tools
item.author: cyrusncy@gmail.com (CyrusN)
item.description: Basic Redirect operators # pipe echo "hello world" | sed 's/ /_/' # redirect the standard output result to file (replace) echo "hello world" > test.txt # redirect the standard output result to file (append) echo "hello world" >> test.txt # redirect file to standard input # e.g. replace all space to _ in text.txt and save to a new file sed 's/ /_/g' < test.txt > test_1.txt # line input cat << end heredoc> hello heredoc> world heredoc> end Useful Commands Cheatsheet d to show directory history type cd -number or directly type the number to go to directory !

item.title: Hardware Architecture
item.author: cyrusncy@gmail.com (CyrusN)
item.description: Basic Hardware Basics - YouTube what is legacy FGA: “legacy” is not a pejorative. Do not use it as such. BIOS POST -> BIOS -> MBR of boot partition -> Bootloader -> Kernel -> init/systemd -> shell/display manager -> startx/xinit UEFI Unified Extensible Firmware Interface - ArchWiki

item.title: How to use GoogleScript
item.author: cyrusncy@gmail.com (CyrusN)
item.description: Useful Examples Send email from spreadsheet data function sendMailByRowNo(rowNo){ // rowString e.g. 1:1 var rowString = Utilities.formatString("%s:%s", rowNo, rowNo) var values = spreadsheet.getRange(rowString).getValues()[0] sendMailByValues(values) } function convertValuesToObject(values) { var obj = {}; obj.timestamp = values[0] obj.email = values[1] obj.title = values[2] return obj } function sendMailByValues(values) { var obj = convertValuesToObject(values) Logger.log(obj) var htmlBody = setEmailBody(obj) var mailAppObject = { to: obj.email, subject: obj.title, htmlBody: htmlBody } // an example to attach a pdf file in google drive // var attachements = DriveApp.

item.title: Mongoose.js and MongoDB
item.author: cyrusncy@gmail.com (CyrusN)
item.description: Custom _id 你schema 有 _id mongo 就唔同你gen, 亦唔可以用 Schema.ObjectId 做ref, 會認唔到type 的 可以令 _id 有意思, e.g. studentSchema, use regno as custom _id e.g. teacherSchema, use teacherInitial as custom _id use uuid if you need to have id before add new stuff e.g. attachmentSchema, need the id to rename the attachment before saving to database. Schema.ObjectId if no need to use custom _id then use Schema.

item.title: Gulp
item.author: cyrusncy@gmail.com (CyrusN)
item.description: Automate and enhance your workflow Example watch jsx change and compile // http://travismaynard.com/writing/getting-started-with-gulp var gulp = require('gulp'); var logger = require('cyrusn-logger'); var react = require('gulp-react'); gulp.task('default', function() { console.log("hello world"); }); var sourcePath = './src/Client-React/source/*.jsx'; gulp.task('react', function(){ return gulp .src(sourcePath) .pipe(react()) // to prevent break when meet error .on('error', function(err){ logger.debug(err.message); this.emit('end'); }) .pipe(gulp.dest('./src/Client-React/dist')); }); gulp.task('watch', function() { gulp.watch(sourcePath, ['react']); }); gulp.task('default', ['react', 'watch']); links gulp Introduction to Gulp.
